    <span key="0c1655bd0c8a4b9683cebb60a842f269"><span offset-key="0c1655bd0c8a4b9683cebb60a842f269:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/#next-steps" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e90953fc083848d08060a1fd678039ae" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="821552d0937d4e19a7df01189ad20da5"><span data-offset-key="821552d0937d4e19a7df01189ad20da5:0">Next steps</span></span></span></a><span key="48c38a621dfd4265a39417be7947d46c"><span offset-key="48c38a621dfd4265a39417be7947d46c:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

## 

<span key="50269cc6868c49d4a5d05323af4be022"><span offset-key="50269cc6868c49d4a5d05323af4be022:0">Specifying authorization details</span></span>

<span key="c81f2043b80549edadb63907e1181699"><span offset-key="c81f2043b80549edadb63907e1181699:0">With a request open in Postman, use the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="c81f2043b80549edadb63907e1181699:2"> tab </span>**Type**<span offset-key="c81f2043b80549edadb63907e1181699:4"> dropdown to select an auth type. Postman will prompt you to complete the relevant details for your selected type. The correct data values will be determined by your API at the server side—if you're using a third party API you will need to refer to the provider for any required auth details.</span></span>

<span key="6456745f99574fc78dad49f8678e0f7c"><span offset-key="6456745f99574fc78dad49f8678e0f7c:0">Auth Types</span></span>

> <span key="8fa4d540afae49f89c7bb4ed3f5768ae"><span offset-key="8fa4d540afae49f89c7bb4ed3f5768ae:0">You can use these auth types with Newman and monitors as well as in the Postman app.</span></span>

<span key="c253bbad49ed4e4283a5ca9ed764bb66"><span offset-key="c253bbad49ed4e4283a5ca9ed764bb66:0">When you select a type, Postman will indicate which parts of the request your details will be included in, for example the header, body, URL, or query parameters. Postman will add your auth details to the relevant parts of the request as soon as you select or enter them, so you can see how your data will be sent before attempting to run the request.</span></span>

<span key="c6dc94d14331405e959d813cf6868cda"><span offset-key="c6dc94d14331405e959d813cf6868cda:0">Auth Setup in Request</span></span>

<span key="29d165619cd0475da65409f1f6be2d36"><span offset-key="29d165619cd0475da65409f1f6be2d36:0">Your auth data will appear in the relevant parts of the request, for example in the </span>**Headers**<span offset-key="29d165619cd0475da65409f1f6be2d36:2"> tab. To show headers added automatically, click the </span>**hidden**<span offset-key="29d165619cd0475da65409f1f6be2d36:4"> button.</span></span>

<span key="cdb484d4c47d4de8afaf0dff5a21ae76"><span offset-key="cdb484d4c47d4de8afaf0dff5a21ae76:0">Hidden Headers</span></span>

<span key="87989cd8de8d41f6b6d2910c4c72d89d"><span offset-key="87989cd8de8d41f6b6d2910c4c72d89d:0">Hover over a header to see where it was added. To change an auth header, navigate back to the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="87989cd8de8d41f6b6d2910c4c72d89d:2"> tab and update your configuration.</span></span>

<span key="4f7a71c5c9d541138e164f72303c8523"><span offset-key="4f7a71c5c9d541138e164f72303c8523:0">Auth Headers</span></span>

> <span key="1fab309545554382b518d5e69629bf06"><span offset-key="1fab309545554382b518d5e69629bf06:0">You cannot override headers added by your </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="1fab309545554382b518d5e69629bf06:2"> selections directly in the </span>**Headers**<span offset-key="1fab309545554382b518d5e69629bf06:4"> tab. If you need different auth headers from those auto-generated by Postman, alter your setup in </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="1fab309545554382b518d5e69629bf06:6">, or remove your auth setup and add headers manually.</span></span>

<span key="6cc69ea91ad54fe9b11406ab22fea5cd"><span offset-key="6cc69ea91ad54fe9b11406ab22fea5cd:0">Your request auth can use environment, collection, and global </span></span><a href="https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="847c3927201343a69b3eb742b715bbe9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="f1e55023891440b6b90fa9fa754b99f4"><span data-offset-key="f1e55023891440b6b90fa9fa754b99f4:0">variables</span></span></span></a><span key="0f1ed1952e6e4bafbcacf99ca65ba4ac"><span offset-key="0f1ed1952e6e4bafbcacf99ca65ba4ac:0">. Postman does not save header data or query parameters to avoid exposing sensitive data such as API keys.</span></span>

> <span key="431fcd74237844738060bdca0c259093"><span offset-key="431fcd74237844738060bdca0c259093:0">You can inspect a raw dump of the entire request including auth data in the Postman console after you send it.</span></span>

## 

<span key="eaef1894f83346139f686e19fb954327"><span offset-key="eaef1894f83346139f686e19fb954327:0">Inheriting auth</span></span>

<span key="f361a3ce2cdf458b872b203b54305774"><span offset-key="f361a3ce2cdf458b872b203b54305774:0">If you group your requests in </span></span><a href="https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/intro-to-collections/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="deff93fa665c4d3f92aea2d377cabd8c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="a0eef156172a40ad816ae732149bc2e7"><span data-offset-key="a0eef156172a40ad816ae732149bc2e7:0">collections</span></span></span></a><span key="957830baf7a2474a9883fa4b903c54a6"><span offset-key="957830baf7a2474a9883fa4b903c54a6:0"> and folders, you can specify auth details to reuse throughout a group.</span></span>

<span key="8c08f734ec034984bd8bfe0f4781c926"><span offset-key="8c08f734ec034984bd8bfe0f4781c926:0">Select a collection or folder in </span>**Collections**<span offset-key="8c08f734ec034984bd8bfe0f4781c926:2"> on the left of Postman. The collection or folder overview will open in a tab for editing. Select the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="8c08f734ec034984bd8bfe0f4781c926:4"> tab.</span></span>

<span key="084431c004784c5c848a8b14bf60d399"><span offset-key="084431c004784c5c848a8b14bf60d399:0">Edit Collection</span></span>

<span key="52fbf48a5da040e9a2d00136a48b4b6f"><span offset-key="52fbf48a5da040e9a2d00136a48b4b6f:0">By default, requests inside the collection or folder will inherit auth from the parent, which means that they'll use the same auth that you've specified at the folder or collection level. To change this for an individual request, make a different selection in the request </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="52fbf48a5da040e9a2d00136a48b4b6f:2"> tab.</span></span>

<span key="ed25da9817b04dcaa212d27308809a56"><span offset-key="ed25da9817b04dcaa212d27308809a56:0">Inherit Authorization</span></span>

<span key="be542f5d4ba449abbc5c75588c8a3843"><span offset-key="be542f5d4ba449abbc5c75588c8a3843:0">You can choose an authorization type upfront using the same technique when you first create a collection or folder.</span></span>

## 

<span key="4bd29003f2af4ed5951c612325b613b2"><span offset-key="4bd29003f2af4ed5951c612325b613b2:0">No auth</span></span>

<span key="4b77a81944bd41e9905accc5ca200662"><span offset-key="4b77a81944bd41e9905accc5ca200662:0">Postman will not attempt to send authorization details with a request unless you specify an auth type. If your request does not require authorization, select </span>**No Auth**<span offset-key="4b77a81944bd41e9905accc5ca200662:2"> from the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="4b77a81944bd41e9905accc5ca200662:4"> tab </span>**Type**<span offset-key="4b77a81944bd41e9905accc5ca200662:6"> dropdown list.</span></span>

## 

<span key="b91432f133e643308acdd26e8e27dc84"><span offset-key="b91432f133e643308acdd26e8e27dc84:0">API key</span></span>

<span key="2ca76d216f4c4cb8be93d8d1cf6c59ac"><span offset-key="2ca76d216f4c4cb8be93d8d1cf6c59ac:0">With API key auth, you send a key-value pair to the API either in the request headers or query parameters. In the request </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="2ca76d216f4c4cb8be93d8d1cf6c59ac:2"> tab, select </span>**API Key**<span offset-key="2ca76d216f4c4cb8be93d8d1cf6c59ac:4"> from the </span>**Type**<span offset-key="2ca76d216f4c4cb8be93d8d1cf6c59ac:6"> list. Enter your key name and value, and select either </span>**Header**<span offset-key="2ca76d216f4c4cb8be93d8d1cf6c59ac:8"> or </span>**Query Params**<span offset-key="2ca76d216f4c4cb8be93d8d1cf6c59ac:10"> from the </span>**Add to**<span offset-key="2ca76d216f4c4cb8be93d8d1cf6c59ac:12"> dropdown. You can store your values in variables for additional security.</span></span>

<span key="15df16946b344e30b6346b94a8b02064"><span offset-key="15df16946b344e30b6346b94a8b02064:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://assets.postman.com/postman-docs/api-key-auth-selection.jpg" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="cbe8454f87ce46ff9515a8809eafa240" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="c935a0aae8334b549255848d1866ce09"><span data-offset-key="c935a0aae8334b549255848d1866ce09:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span data-slate-void="true" data-key="5d1091359e744894a4f6c720e304d1e1"><span></span></span></span></a>

<span key="12753b3e009240cfa1a8ac915d8c798d"><span offset-key="12753b3e009240cfa1a8ac915d8c798d:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span key="b9a92c8e41ff43d0b83f27baac15dd8b"><span offset-key="b9a92c8e41ff43d0b83f27baac15dd8b:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="de977715ea4c4b8fa48245f3e44b3d5b"><span offset-key="de977715ea4c4b8fa48245f3e44b3d5b:0">Postman will append the relevant information to your request </span>**Headers**<span offset-key="de977715ea4c4b8fa48245f3e44b3d5b:2"> or the URL query string.</span></span>

## 

<span key="51ec80bfe6e34ae6837f78ef0bb5443c"><span offset-key="51ec80bfe6e34ae6837f78ef0bb5443c:0">Bearer token</span></span>

<span key="b70e10604abc4ae7b64cc14447dfaadd"><span offset-key="b70e10604abc4ae7b64cc14447dfaadd:0">Bearer tokens allow requests to authenticate using an access key, such as a JSON Web Token (JWT). The token is a text string, included in the request header. In the request </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="b70e10604abc4ae7b64cc14447dfaadd:2"> tab, select </span>**Bearer Token**<span offset-key="b70e10604abc4ae7b64cc14447dfaadd:4"> from the </span>**Type**<span offset-key="b70e10604abc4ae7b64cc14447dfaadd:6"> dropdown list. In the </span>**Token**<span offset-key="b70e10604abc4ae7b64cc14447dfaadd:8"> field, enter your API key value—or for added security, store it in a variable and reference the variable by name.</span></span><span slate-void="true" key="9f62d03a8ccb4b9aa1a7ac7a34cdbf1a"></span>

<span key="ddc00fba0fdd4b968f416cdb0745531e"><span offset-key="ddc00fba0fdd4b968f416cdb0745531e:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="18996715102c41d282269e5671c9ccc7"><span offset-key="18996715102c41d282269e5671c9ccc7:0">Postman will append the token value to the text "Bearer " in the required format to the request Authorization header as follows:</span></span>

1

<span key="6cb6827ab78245d5a09cd94694aa78a6"><span offset-key="6cb6827ab78245d5a09cd94694aa78a6:0">Bearer &lt;Your API key></span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

> <span key="fb8867fa6df64a15b0e03cb6a5c3e412"><span offset-key="fb8867fa6df64a15b0e03cb6a5c3e412:0">If a custom prefix is needed, use an </span></span><a href="https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/#api-key" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="304834a5c00c4a71aaed398780801862" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="a3e1298fc2774bc88675253f02e84fa3"><span data-offset-key="a3e1298fc2774bc88675253f02e84fa3:0">API Key</span></span></span></a><span key="8a1880efbdf54e629afbe587317c153a"><span offset-key="8a1880efbdf54e629afbe587317c153a:0"> with a key of </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="8a1880efbdf54e629afbe587317c153a:2">.</span></span>

<span key="3ab9c7ee7183438186f45d89176ba709"><span offset-key="3ab9c7ee7183438186f45d89176ba709:0">Auth Header Info</span></span>

## 

<span key="dab73a4a548b42adb2feabf48ee2ac34"><span offset-key="dab73a4a548b42adb2feabf48ee2ac34:0">Basic auth</span></span>

<span key="395f4a6c0d35483e8b9c88c35a69b1d6"><span offset-key="395f4a6c0d35483e8b9c88c35a69b1d6:0">Basic authentication involves sending a verified username and password with your request. In the request </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="395f4a6c0d35483e8b9c88c35a69b1d6:2"> tab, select </span>**Basic Auth**<span offset-key="395f4a6c0d35483e8b9c88c35a69b1d6:4"> from the </span>**Type**<span offset-key="395f4a6c0d35483e8b9c88c35a69b1d6:6"> dropdown list.</span></span>

<span key="12298eb9beb64042bf66aa5651e2ddec"><span offset-key="12298eb9beb64042bf66aa5651e2ddec:0">Basic Auth</span></span>

<span key="ca141c0ee3eb4acbbea8ff40a6fe267f"><span offset-key="ca141c0ee3eb4acbbea8ff40a6fe267f:0">Enter your API login details in the </span>**Username**<span offset-key="ca141c0ee3eb4acbbea8ff40a6fe267f:2"> and </span>**Password**<span offset-key="ca141c0ee3eb4acbbea8ff40a6fe267f:4"> fields—for additional security you can store these in variables.</span></span>

<span key="0a7df5ff6ce743b298c21b98ad272852"><span offset-key="0a7df5ff6ce743b298c21b98ad272852:0">In the request </span>**Headers**<span offset-key="0a7df5ff6ce743b298c21b98ad272852:2">, you will see that the Authorization header is going to pass the API a Base64 encoded string representing your username and password values, appended to the text "Basic " as follows:</span></span>

1

<span key="1dd9eee19e5d4d77b89c6159c8d9f840"><span offset-key="1dd9eee19e5d4d77b89c6159c8d9f840:0">Basic &lt;Base64 encoded username and password></span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="b7eed6a909cf43a8872fd3f8d89bf2d7"><span offset-key="b7eed6a909cf43a8872fd3f8d89bf2d7:0">Basic Auth Encoded</span></span>

## 

<span key="d8e9ab2745074c7fb083a69892f6abd4"><span offset-key="d8e9ab2745074c7fb083a69892f6abd4:0">Digest auth</span></span>

<span key="590b33767ca343ccad4516da4c42304f"><span offset-key="590b33767ca343ccad4516da4c42304f:0">With Digest auth, the client sends a first request to the API, and the server responds with a few details, including a number that can be used only once (nonce), a realm value, and a </span>`401`<span offset-key="590b33767ca343ccad4516da4c42304f:2"> unauthorized response. You then send back an encrypted array of data including username and password combined with the data received from the server in the first request. The server uses the passed data to generate an encrypted string and compares it against what you sent in order to authenticate your request.</span></span>

<span key="6d4b6ab161934c979b87cf9935420f91"><span offset-key="6d4b6ab161934c979b87cf9935420f91:0">In the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="6d4b6ab161934c979b87cf9935420f91:2"> tab for a request, select </span>**Digest Auth**<span offset-key="6d4b6ab161934c979b87cf9935420f91:4"> from the </span>**Type**<span offset-key="6d4b6ab161934c979b87cf9935420f91:6"> dropdown list. Postman will present fields for both stages of authentication request—however it will autocomplete the fields for the second request using data returned from the server by the first request. To allow Postman to automate the flow, enter </span>**Username**<span offset-key="6d4b6ab161934c979b87cf9935420f91:8"> and </span>**Password**<span offset-key="6d4b6ab161934c979b87cf9935420f91:10"> values (or variables) and these will be sent with the second request.</span></span>

<span key="0ba054e6ef55439db7acf6877c366baf"><span offset-key="0ba054e6ef55439db7acf6877c366baf:0">Digest Auth</span></span>

> <span key="7850a03aafcb47f3bb541cd7d95ec2bd"><span offset-key="7850a03aafcb47f3bb541cd7d95ec2bd:0">If you don't want Postman to automatically extract the data, check the box to disable retrying the request. If you do this, you will need to complete the advanced fields and run each request manually.</span></span>

<span key="c3783c0e93d14192a94075bafbb034e0"><span offset-key="c3783c0e93d14192a94075bafbb034e0:0">The advanced fields are optional, and Postman will attempt to populate them automatically when your request runs.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8c2a533a9806412692f86e41c6e5edd4">**Realm:**<span offset-key="8c2a533a9806412692f86e41c6e5edd4:1"> A string specified by the server in the </span>`WWW-Authenticate`<span offset-key="8c2a533a9806412692f86e41c6e5edd4:3"> response header.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="954e15c26b894b878c2cab2aec308f38">**Nonce:**<span offset-key="954e15c26b894b878c2cab2aec308f38:1"> A unique string specified by the server in the </span>`WWW-Authenticate`<span offset-key="954e15c26b894b878c2cab2aec308f38:3"> response header.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="775cbded943a4ed09531e76c7c627378">**Algorithm:**<span offset-key="775cbded943a4ed09531e76c7c627378:1"> A string that indicates a pair of algorithms used to produce the digest and a checksum. Postman supports </span>`MD5`<span offset-key="775cbded943a4ed09531e76c7c627378:3"> and </span>`SHA`<span offset-key="775cbded943a4ed09531e76c7c627378:5"> algorithms.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="373208279101472ea61917ad7479c9b2">**qop:**<span offset-key="373208279101472ea61917ad7479c9b2:1"> The quality of protection applied to the message. The value must be one of the alternatives specified by the server in the </span>`WWW-Authenticate`<span offset-key="373208279101472ea61917ad7479c9b2:3"> response header.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="74a3ccaba8cc42e9b8f416f7a865b8e7">**Nonce Count:**<span offset-key="74a3ccaba8cc42e9b8f416f7a865b8e7:1"> The hexadecimal count of the number of requests (including the current request) that the client has sent with the nonce value in this request.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4e9e9a129e54495994e15c083a3470e9">**Client Nonce:**<span offset-key="4e9e9a129e54495994e15c083a3470e9:1"> An opaque quoted string value provided by the client, used by both client and server to avoid chosen plaintext attacks, to provide mutual authentication, and to provide some message integrity protection.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8ab380b660094b0b8b0a85c5697fb828">**Opaque:**<span offset-key="8ab380b660094b0b8b0a85c5697fb828:1"> A string of data specified by the server in the </span>`WWW-Authenticate`<span offset-key="8ab380b660094b0b8b0a85c5697fb828:3"> response header, which should be used unchanged with URIs in the same protection space.</span></span>

## 

<span key="f2a201716acb41b6b477d4795527999b"><span offset-key="f2a201716acb41b6b477d4795527999b:0">OAuth 1.0</span></span>

<span key="6a0567aa891b4125bfabbba70f0d8b16"><span offset-key="6a0567aa891b4125bfabbba70f0d8b16:0">OAuth 1.0 allows client applications to access data provided by a third-party API. For example, as a user of a service you can grant another application access to your data with that service without exposing your login details. Accessing user data via the OAuth 1.0 flow involves a few requests back and forth between client application, user, and service provider.</span></span>

<span key="5448c7849d7c4df6b4059d22559ea707"><span offset-key="5448c7849d7c4df6b4059d22559ea707:0">OAuth 1.0 is sometimes referred to as "two-legged" (auth only between client and server) or "three-legged" (where a client requests data for a user of a third-party service). An example OAuth 1.0 flow could run as follows:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="7bb5488bf59e4363a6762427448d2b53"><span offset-key="7bb5488bf59e4363a6762427448d2b53:0">To request user data with a third-party service, a consumer (client application) requests an access token using credentials such as a key and secret.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6d5e21f028b542dd851f7ad7a8ff7778"><span offset-key="6d5e21f028b542dd851f7ad7a8ff7778:0">The service provider issues an initial token (that doesn't provide access to user data) and the consumer requests authorization from the user.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9c2ef38121294d07ae41d695d120b5b4"><span offset-key="9c2ef38121294d07ae41d695d120b5b4:0">When the user grants auth, the consumer makes a request to exchange the temporary token for an access token, passing verification from the user auth.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2141f9fbd07046718788493201f090c1"><span offset-key="2141f9fbd07046718788493201f090c1:0">The service provider returns the access token and the consumer can then make requests to the service provider to access the user's data.</span></span>

> <span key="98caf367f27a4b919de9f93df697db03"><span offset-key="98caf367f27a4b919de9f93df697db03:0">Postman supports </span></span><a href="https://oauth.net/core/1.0a/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e6bacf9024aa432ba82857fee349db1a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="b4a3fb365540452fac3597925b594b3f"><span data-offset-key="b4a3fb365540452fac3597925b594b3f:0">OAuth Core 1.0 Revision A</span></span></span></a><span key="9a053046bb934071bb8370959f0e914d"><span offset-key="9a053046bb934071bb8370959f0e914d:0">.</span></span>

<span key="8cfd967c901f467282bbb8ae1756debe"><span offset-key="8cfd967c901f467282bbb8ae1756debe:0">In the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="8cfd967c901f467282bbb8ae1756debe:2"> tab for a request, select </span>**OAuth 1.0**<span offset-key="8cfd967c901f467282bbb8ae1756debe:4"> from the </span>**Type**<span offset-key="8cfd967c901f467282bbb8ae1756debe:6"> dropdown list.</span></span>

<span key="477adbdc83f04859a908ac30e10e4efc"><span offset-key="477adbdc83f04859a908ac30e10e4efc:0">OAuth 1.0</span></span>

<span key="66a4415c4f18438c848fb9c8a5b55219"><span offset-key="66a4415c4f18438c848fb9c8a5b55219:0">Select a </span>**Signature Method**<span offset-key="66a4415c4f18438c848fb9c8a5b55219:2"> from the drop-down list—this will determine which parameters you should include with your request. Postman supports </span>`HMAC-SHA1`<span offset-key="66a4415c4f18438c848fb9c8a5b55219:4">, </span>`HMAC-SHA256`<span offset-key="66a4415c4f18438c848fb9c8a5b55219:6">, </span>`HMAC-SHA512`<span offset-key="66a4415c4f18438c848fb9c8a5b55219:8">, </span>`RSA-SHA1`<span offset-key="66a4415c4f18438c848fb9c8a5b55219:10">, </span>`RSA-SHA256`<span offset-key="66a4415c4f18438c848fb9c8a5b55219:12">, </span>`RSA-SHA512`<span offset-key="66a4415c4f18438c848fb9c8a5b55219:14">, and </span>`PLAINTEXT`<span offset-key="66a4415c4f18438c848fb9c8a5b55219:16">.</span></span>

<span key="857ef220a242422f886ca370d8600fd6"><span offset-key="857ef220a242422f886ca370d8600fd6:0">OAuth 1.0 signature methods</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9380be0cce9047bf818261a183b47745"><span offset-key="9380be0cce9047bf818261a183b47745:0">If your server requires an </span>`HMAC`<span offset-key="9380be0cce9047bf818261a183b47745:2"> or </span>`PLAINTEXT`<span offset-key="9380be0cce9047bf818261a183b47745:4"> signature, Postman will provide </span>**Consumer Key**<span offset-key="9380be0cce9047bf818261a183b47745:6">, </span>**Consumer Secret**<span offset-key="9380be0cce9047bf818261a183b47745:8">, </span>**Access Token**<span offset-key="9380be0cce9047bf818261a183b47745:10">, and </span>**Token Secret**<span offset-key="9380be0cce9047bf818261a183b47745:12"> fields.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5b97ad4a584d497da1b9b89f33e267e5"><span offset-key="5b97ad4a584d497da1b9b89f33e267e5:0">If you're using an </span>`RSA`<span offset-key="5b97ad4a584d497da1b9b89f33e267e5:2"> signature, Postman will present </span>**Consumer Key**<span offset-key="5b97ad4a584d497da1b9b89f33e267e5:4">, </span>**Access Token**<span offset-key="5b97ad4a584d497da1b9b89f33e267e5:6">, and </span>**Private Key**<span offset-key="5b97ad4a584d497da1b9b89f33e267e5:8"> inputs.</span></span>

<span key="d4409066adb4425b85c77462d34dc367"><span offset-key="d4409066adb4425b85c77462d34dc367:0">You can optionally set advanced details—otherwise Postman will attempt to autocomplete these.</span></span>

<span key="3c844884cbba483c8b0eaa1a508ee616"><span offset-key="3c844884cbba483c8b0eaa1a508ee616:0">You can include the auth details either in the request headers or in the body / URL—select one from the dropdown list. Open the </span>**Headers**<span offset-key="3c844884cbba483c8b0eaa1a508ee616:2"> or </span>**Body**<span offset-key="3c844884cbba483c8b0eaa1a508ee616:4"> tab if you want to check how the details will be included with the request.</span></span>

<span key="b9eaace2b9d84de8b599ce2dddf08ea6"><span offset-key="b9eaace2b9d84de8b599ce2dddf08ea6:0">If you send the OAuth 1.0 data in the headers, you will see an Authorization header sending your key and secret values appended to the string " OAuth " together with additional comma-separated required details.</span></span>

<span key="f6b93796e1454bfabdeaf89e37c9186d"><span offset-key="f6b93796e1454bfabdeaf89e37c9186d:0">OAuth 1.0 Headers</span></span>

> <span key="c9ab5e65a17542eaa7bf2c00072024a1"><span offset-key="c9ab5e65a17542eaa7bf2c00072024a1:0">Postman will append the OAuth 1.0 information to the request </span>**Headers**<span offset-key="c9ab5e65a17542eaa7bf2c00072024a1:2"> when you have completed all required fields in your </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="c9ab5e65a17542eaa7bf2c00072024a1:4"> setup.</span></span>

<span key="889e22ec5ae34ae7a8c24446686cf8f8"><span offset-key="889e22ec5ae34ae7a8c24446686cf8f8:0">If you send the OAuth 1.0 data in the body and URL, you will find the data added either in the request </span>**Body**<span offset-key="889e22ec5ae34ae7a8c24446686cf8f8:2"> or </span>**Parameters**<span offset-key="889e22ec5ae34ae7a8c24446686cf8f8:4"> depending on the request method.</span></span>

<span key="6b92412b30a644e8819ff1ccbff26681"><span offset-key="6b92412b30a644e8819ff1ccbff26681:0">OAuth 1.0 Query Parameters</span></span>

<span key="74d88e5003544aed9dc2b20fb622d4b5"><span offset-key="74d88e5003544aed9dc2b20fb622d4b5:0">If the request method is </span>`POST`<span offset-key="74d88e5003544aed9dc2b20fb622d4b5:2"> or </span>`PUT`<span offset-key="74d88e5003544aed9dc2b20fb622d4b5:4">, and if the request body type is </span>`x-www-form-urlencoded`<span offset-key="74d88e5003544aed9dc2b20fb622d4b5:6">, Postman will add the authorization parameters to the request body. Otherwise, for example in a </span>`GET`<span offset-key="74d88e5003544aed9dc2b20fb622d4b5:8"> request, your key and secret data will be passed in the URL query parameters.</span></span>

<span key="fad2dc6e29f84e629ebfc4fb239850ac"><span offset-key="fad2dc6e29f84e629ebfc4fb239850ac:0">The OAuth 1.0 auth parameter values are as follows:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="59a996ca997a41f79dcdb6548c2417c1">**Signature Method**<span offset-key="59a996ca997a41f79dcdb6548c2417c1:1">: The method your API uses to authenticate requests.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d3c05e013ce14109b276a92fcf8235cf">**Consumer Key:**<span offset-key="d3c05e013ce14109b276a92fcf8235cf:1"> A value used to identify a consumer with the service provider.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="9a2df30fb19248e08236cf890a580790">**Consumer Secret:**<span offset-key="9a2df30fb19248e08236cf890a580790:1"> A value used by the consumer to establish ownership of the key. </span>*For* `HMAC` *and* `PLAINTEXT` *signing methods.*</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="060e48cb8eed473bbf3e23b039357dd7">**Access Token:**<span offset-key="060e48cb8eed473bbf3e23b039357dd7:1"> A value representing the consumer's permission to access the user's data.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="32e1e221a5dd4d8d8317a6694c3cbef9">**Token Secret:**<span offset-key="32e1e221a5dd4d8d8317a6694c3cbef9:1"> A value used by the consumer to establish ownership of a given token. </span>*For* `HMAC` *and* `PLAINTEXT` *signing methods.*</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="96647e5425a541df88ee1df33d5ff155">**Private Key:**<span offset-key="96647e5425a541df88ee1df33d5ff155:1"> A private key to generate the auth signature. </span>*For* `RSA` *signing methods.*</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6ceb1a9a596a47e6aeda3482b6095704"><span offset-key="6ceb1a9a596a47e6aeda3482b6095704:0">Advanced Parameters:</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="442cacf3cffb4b14ae1e882fbac558df">**Callback URL:**<span offset-key="442cacf3cffb4b14ae1e882fbac558df:1"> URL service provider will redirect to following user authorization. </span>*Required if your server uses OAuth 1.0 Revision A.*</span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="e064ba9a600a4119ae70f4572d7f428f">**Verifier:**<span offset-key="e064ba9a600a4119ae70f4572d7f428f:1"> Verification code from service provider after user auth.</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="32d685560f3647a1acfdd156b184089f">**Time Stamp:**<span offset-key="32d685560f3647a1acfdd156b184089f:1"> The timestamp the server uses to prevent replay attacks outside the time window.</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="ccf94d3b5e324aa7b34d2bb1b2e2beb5">**Nonce:**<span offset-key="ccf94d3b5e324aa7b34d2bb1b2e2beb5:1"> A random string generated by the client.</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="b156c21720be4c58ac7027d977ef191b">**Version:**<span offset-key="b156c21720be4c58ac7027d977ef191b:1"> The version of the OAuth authentication protocol (1.0).</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="42f44fc475bf4673b5f5dd5247117c41">**Realm:**<span offset-key="42f44fc475bf4673b5f5dd5247117c41:1"> A string specified by the server in the </span>`WWW-Authenticate`<span offset-key="42f44fc475bf4673b5f5dd5247117c41:3"> response header.</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="9958d8e9af3e4fb38ddbb40d00c64463">**Include body hash:**<span offset-key="9958d8e9af3e4fb38ddbb40d00c64463:1"> Hash for integrity check with request bodies </span>*other than*<span offset-key="9958d8e9af3e4fb38ddbb40d00c64463:3"> </span>`application/x-www-form-urlencoded`<span offset-key="9958d8e9af3e4fb38ddbb40d00c64463:5">. </span>*Disabled when you're using callback URL / verifier.*</span>

> <span key="c6ced270dcf2488dadfbfa1298866150"><span offset-key="c6ced270dcf2488dadfbfa1298866150:0">If your server implementation of OAuth 1.0 requires it, check </span>**Add empty parameters to signature**<span offset-key="c6ced270dcf2488dadfbfa1298866150:2">.</span></span>
>
> <span key="e74a3ee87b88405fa197876ab0be8873"><span offset-key="e74a3ee87b88405fa197876ab0be8873:0">You can also check the box to </span>**Encode the parameters in the authorization header**<span offset-key="e74a3ee87b88405fa197876ab0be8873:2"> for your request.</span></span>

## 

<span key="0f2e59a6a3544f92b6dc38c711822542"><span offset-key="0f2e59a6a3544f92b6dc38c711822542:0">OAuth 2.0</span></span>

<span key="1ca4ec10012c46c2abdb0125a0485d08"><span offset-key="1ca4ec10012c46c2abdb0125a0485d08:0">OAuth 1.0 allows client applications to access data provided by a third-party API. For example, as a user of a service you can grant another application access to your data with that service without exposing your login details. With OAuth 2.0, you first retrieve an access token for the API, then use that token to authenticate future requests. Accessing data via the OAuth 2.0 flow varies greatly between API service providers, but typically involves a few requests back and forth between client application, user, and API.</span></span>

<span key="8eece2456f364bbd87777f5cc4cb432f"><span offset-key="8eece2456f364bbd87777f5cc4cb432f:0">An example OAuth 2.0 flow could run as follows:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5352a10c874f4a97a27c3f9227a1bbff"><span offset-key="5352a10c874f4a97a27c3f9227a1bbff:0">A client application makes a request for the user to authorize access to their data.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="8bd13c7ca38c4c19a193653f26f5244a"><span offset-key="8bd13c7ca38c4c19a193653f26f5244a:0">If the user grants access, the application then requests an access token from the service provider, passing the access grant from the user and authentication details to identify the client.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="0df9f37e67be4e69a0193cb8ae9525b6"><span offset-key="0df9f37e67be4e69a0193cb8ae9525b6:0">The service provider validates these details and returns an access token.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="714667bb3a84437ba39cf3ba8ddc80ad"><span offset-key="714667bb3a84437ba39cf3ba8ddc80ad:0">The client uses the access token to request the user data via the service provider.</span></span>

<span key="e5d3b7f583314b4da35869df402b63bf"><span offset-key="e5d3b7f583314b4da35869df402b63bf:0">In the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="e5d3b7f583314b4da35869df402b63bf:2"> tab for a request, select </span>**OAuth 2.0**<span offset-key="e5d3b7f583314b4da35869df402b63bf:4"> from the </span>**Type**<span offset-key="e5d3b7f583314b4da35869df402b63bf:6"> dropdown list. Specify whether you want pass the auth details in the request URL or headers.</span></span>

> <span key="20cd158cf5e14cfcb976b9f51662fea7"><span offset-key="20cd158cf5e14cfcb976b9f51662fea7:0">By default Postman will append the access token to </span>`Bearer`<span offset-key="20cd158cf5e14cfcb976b9f51662fea7:2"> in the Authorization header for your request, but if your server implementation requires a different prefix, you can specify it in the </span>**Header Prefix**<span offset-key="20cd158cf5e14cfcb976b9f51662fea7:4"> field.</span></span>

<span key="4da0ce15a39545d9879edc25326b2e76"><span offset-key="4da0ce15a39545d9879edc25326b2e76:0">To request an access token, fill out the fields in the </span>**Configure New Token**<span offset-key="4da0ce15a39545d9879edc25326b2e76:2"> section, and click </span>**Get New Access Token**<span offset-key="4da0ce15a39545d9879edc25326b2e76:4">. You can save both the token and the details to generate a token with your request or collection.</span></span>

<span key="5aefd1d73e4f41dcb60e18ef82075e0b"><span offset-key="5aefd1d73e4f41dcb60e18ef82075e0b:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://assets.postman.com/postman-docs/oauth2.v8-2.jpg" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="f41194ae0b5b447081f30976ab7dd2c0" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="4f0c47faf01b49b7bd652322e5481565"><span data-offset-key="4f0c47faf01b49b7bd652322e5481565:0"><span data-slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span data-slate-void="true" data-key="c6ee24c83ec04a55b935764f73623665"><span></span></span></span></a>

<span key="f9b77b82ae6e4f9a9340c4310af96350"><span offset-key="f9b77b82ae6e4f9a9340c4310af96350:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><span key="0fdd2186fd074d158a8d4855b76514c3"><span offset-key="0fdd2186fd074d158a8d4855b76514c3:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

> <span key="f60aa36f17384f29ba1c7ae482910a17"><span offset-key="f60aa36f17384f29ba1c7ae482910a17:0">Once you have a token value generated and added, it will appear in the request </span>**Headers**<span offset-key="f60aa36f17384f29ba1c7ae482910a17:2">.</span></span>

<span key="8e41c0326b954c0abf3f798f46e88803"><span offset-key="8e41c0326b954c0abf3f798f46e88803:0">Enter the details for your client application, and any auth details from the service provider. This allows you to replicate your application auth flow inside Postman in order to test authenticated requests.</span></span>

> <span key="d240b0b215b44313a2e8bb05377f4de1"><span offset-key="d240b0b215b44313a2e8bb05377f4de1:0">You can share token credentials with your team by clicking the sync button next to an available token. By default Postman will not sync your token in case you do not want to share it.</span></span>

<span key="494649d1361844b1a85d1e483c9670a2"><span offset-key="494649d1361844b1a85d1e483c9670a2:0">Postman will prompt you to supply specific details depending on the OAuth 2.0 </span>**grant**<span offset-key="494649d1361844b1a85d1e483c9670a2:2"> type, which can be </span></span><a href="https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/#authorization-code" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="983c557a5101492c8afe5c7fb26bb531" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="40f6f11ef1624786af9e34be2fc69eea"><span data-offset-key="40f6f11ef1624786af9e34be2fc69eea:0">Authorization code</span></span></span></a><span key="34862b1bbe7c48ee94fc3f6b10bf353e"><span offset-key="34862b1bbe7c48ee94fc3f6b10bf353e:0">, </span></span><a href="https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/#implicit" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9144034346ba4c9e8c98b9e23c9d69ca" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="4743d39f47184e49bca1f1ebcdd66e84"><span data-offset-key="4743d39f47184e49bca1f1ebcdd66e84:0">Implicit</span></span></span></a><span key="d0f75d18f79642968b0c9aaee7a1b5c9"><span offset-key="d0f75d18f79642968b0c9aaee7a1b5c9:0">, </span></span><a href="https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/#password-credentials" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c64d11495d264f1eb9486f9599dfac09" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="92c22e5651fb4bb883675271d58d82b2"><span data-offset-key="92c22e5651fb4bb883675271d58d82b2:0">Password credentials</span></span></span></a><span key="90780fafd218438db2f60816f58af375"><span offset-key="90780fafd218438db2f60816f58af375:0">, or </span></span><a href="https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/authorization/#client-credentials" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="89b0ad51512b43e69cf3c3ac7ab0e287" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="ea093818fff7418589cf73768a529b46"><span data-offset-key="ea093818fff7418589cf73768a529b46:0">Client credentials</span></span></span></a><span key="2e32b16823a344c8bf5e38a0b57d276d"><span offset-key="2e32b16823a344c8bf5e38a0b57d276d:0">.</span></span>

### 

<span key="003efc796680430b97dcd4e4c4b8c08f"><span offset-key="003efc796680430b97dcd4e4c4b8c08f:0">Authorization code</span></span>

<span key="5ca0b7afa6d5462b9db8f78c1f89c996"><span offset-key="5ca0b7afa6d5462b9db8f78c1f89c996:0">Authorization code grant type requires the user to authenticate with the provider—an authorization code is then sent back to the client app, extracted, and exchanged with the provider for an access token to authenticate subsequent requests.</span></span>

<span key="ddcdaa2529364f339e65b65bfde10dc6"><span offset-key="ddcdaa2529364f339e65b65bfde10dc6:0">To use authorization code grant type, enter a </span>**Callback URL**<span offset-key="ddcdaa2529364f339e65b65bfde10dc6:2"> for your client application (which should be registered with the API provider), together with various details provided by the API service including </span>**Auth URL**<span offset-key="ddcdaa2529364f339e65b65bfde10dc6:4">, </span>**Access Token URL**<span offset-key="ddcdaa2529364f339e65b65bfde10dc6:6">, </span>**Client ID**<span offset-key="ddcdaa2529364f339e65b65bfde10dc6:8">, and </span>**Client Secret**<span offset-key="ddcdaa2529364f339e65b65bfde10dc6:10">.</span></span>

> <span key="48434903b69b41828f2d8e9539f74003"><span offset-key="48434903b69b41828f2d8e9539f74003:0">You can enter your auth details in the web browser, instead of in Postman, if you prefer, by selecting </span>**Authorize using browser**<span offset-key="48434903b69b41828f2d8e9539f74003:2">.</span></span>

<span key="3b36e41814cb4cc0a719542ddd1554ca">**Authorization code (With PKCE)**</span>

<span key="0b28c070fa224769826d5aefccc2b17e"><span offset-key="0b28c070fa224769826d5aefccc2b17e:0">You can use PKCE (Proof Key for Code Exchange) with OAuth 2.0. When you select </span>**Authorization Code (With PKCE)**<span offset-key="0b28c070fa224769826d5aefccc2b17e:2"> two additional fields will become available for </span>**Code Challenge Method**<span offset-key="0b28c070fa224769826d5aefccc2b17e:4"> and </span>**Code Verifier**<span offset-key="0b28c070fa224769826d5aefccc2b17e:6">. You can opt to use </span>`SHA-256`<span offset-key="0b28c070fa224769826d5aefccc2b17e:8"> or </span>`Plain`<span offset-key="0b28c070fa224769826d5aefccc2b17e:10"> algorithms to generate the code challenge. The verifier is an optional 43-128 character string to connect the authorization request to the token request.</span></span>

> <span key="47a12922ecca4e0dbc552c48ec4b3992">**Authorization code (With PKCE)**<span offset-key="47a12922ecca4e0dbc552c48ec4b3992:1"> grant type coupled with </span>**Authorize using browser**<span offset-key="47a12922ecca4e0dbc552c48ec4b3992:3"> is recommended to prevent auth code interception attacks.</span></span>

### 

<span key="706d1c33abe3458ba2229a945da0666e"><span offset-key="706d1c33abe3458ba2229a945da0666e:0">Implicit</span></span>

<span key="c7acccfcdb8442a29cfecb13fbb49f3f"><span offset-key="c7acccfcdb8442a29cfecb13fbb49f3f:0">Implicit grant type returns an access token to the client straight away without requiring the additional auth code step (and is therefore less secure).</span></span>

<span key="90330e0d0acd47ef8e15d3fa6afe4245"><span offset-key="90330e0d0acd47ef8e15d3fa6afe4245:0">To use implicit grant type with your requests in Postman, enter a </span>**Callback URL**<span offset-key="90330e0d0acd47ef8e15d3fa6afe4245:2"> you have registered with the API provider, the provider </span>**Auth URL**<span offset-key="90330e0d0acd47ef8e15d3fa6afe4245:4">, and a </span>**Client ID**<span offset-key="90330e0d0acd47ef8e15d3fa6afe4245:6"> for the app you have registered.</span></span>

> <span key="f4d8df12ae2140ba999d4a66e7bf26fd"><span offset-key="f4d8df12ae2140ba999d4a66e7bf26fd:0">You can enter your auth details in the web browser, instead of in Postman, if you prefer, by selecting </span>**Authorize using browser**<span offset-key="f4d8df12ae2140ba999d4a66e7bf26fd:2">.</span></span>

### 

<span key="63486ef373ee477e92d649c196bdeed1"><span offset-key="63486ef373ee477e92d649c196bdeed1:0">Password credentials</span></span>

<span key="f501ab29c550425bbce2e11da9c40d20"><span offset-key="f501ab29c550425bbce2e11da9c40d20:0">OAuth 2.0 Password grant type involves sending username and password directly from the client and is therefore not recommended if you're dealing with third-party data.</span></span>

<span key="b3e1059abc224496961a7b95bdba34e4"><span offset-key="b3e1059abc224496961a7b95bdba34e4:0">To use password grant type, enter your API provider's </span>**Access Token URL**<span offset-key="b3e1059abc224496961a7b95bdba34e4:2">, together with the </span>**Username**<span offset-key="b3e1059abc224496961a7b95bdba34e4:4"> and </span>**Password**<span offset-key="b3e1059abc224496961a7b95bdba34e4:6">. In some cases you will also need to provide a client ID and secret.</span></span>

### 

<span key="0f64a328dd6740a5b1049fb7a2026bee"><span offset-key="0f64a328dd6740a5b1049fb7a2026bee:0">Client credentials</span></span>

<span key="3e3f7ee1b67b4e4ba27f3e3cca1ea11f"><span offset-key="3e3f7ee1b67b4e4ba27f3e3cca1ea11f:0">Client credentials grant type is typically not used to access user data but instead for data associated with the client application.</span></span>

<span key="4170f7a16d5a4d859f5bf3455a897a96"><span offset-key="4170f7a16d5a4d859f5bf3455a897a96:0">Enter the provider's </span>**Access Token URL**<span offset-key="4170f7a16d5a4d859f5bf3455a897a96:2">, together with the </span>**Client ID**<span offset-key="4170f7a16d5a4d859f5bf3455a897a96:4"> and </span>**Client Secret**<span offset-key="4170f7a16d5a4d859f5bf3455a897a96:6"> for your registered application.</span></span>

### 

<span key="c0fb95749a5c4eda9aa359da2cb64fe3"><span offset-key="c0fb95749a5c4eda9aa359da2cb64fe3:0">Requesting an OAuth 2.0 token</span></span>

<span key="22cd7c15a7c54afdb56a4e08b700685b"><span offset-key="22cd7c15a7c54afdb56a4e08b700685b:0">The full list of parameters to request a new access token is as follows, depending on your grant type.</span></span>

<span key="d148d1b63e704a9795ea5ba14101aadb">**Configuration Options tab**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="735a830b6b7849339c0e37bf5238a7d2">**Token Name:**<span offset-key="735a830b6b7849339c0e37bf5238a7d2:1"> The name you want to use for the token.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="e68fb5dd221d4cdca7115c59f3ccde42">**Grant Type:**<span offset-key="e68fb5dd221d4cdca7115c59f3ccde42:1"> A dropdown list of options. This will depend on the API service provider requirements.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="aa68b68efcca466cbf9e5bd63b93e1ff">**Callback URL:**<span offset-key="aa68b68efcca466cbf9e5bd63b93e1ff:1"> The client application callback URL redirected to after auth, and that should be registered with the API provider. If not provided, Postman will use a default empty URL and attempt to extract the code or access token from it. If this does not work for your API, you can use the following URL: </span>`https://oauth.pstmn.io/v1/browser-callback`</span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="f1c0aae1539c4160be97ef644ec44269">**Authorize using browser:**<span offset-key="f1c0aae1539c4160be97ef644ec44269:1"> You can enter your credentials in your web browser, instead of the pop-up that appears in Postman by default when you use the </span>**Authorization code**<span offset-key="f1c0aae1539c4160be97ef644ec44269:3"> or </span>**Implicit**<span offset-key="f1c0aae1539c4160be97ef644ec44269:5"> grant type. Checking this box will set the </span>**Callback URL**<span offset-key="f1c0aae1539c4160be97ef644ec44269:7"> to return to Postman. If you opt to authorize using the browser, make sure pop-ups are disabled for the callback URL, otherwise it will not work.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="85d62834fe2248ccb4758d72aaa5918f">**Auth URL:**<span offset-key="85d62834fe2248ccb4758d72aaa5918f:1"> The endpoint for the API provider authorization server, to retrieve the auth code.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="02cb8d1d8c514ffbb467261ebb3225c6">**Access Token URL:**<span offset-key="02cb8d1d8c514ffbb467261ebb3225c6:1"> The provider's authentication server, to exchange an authorization code for an access token.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="11ac612abac44d37b34c0cf06f228681">**Client ID:**<span offset-key="11ac612abac44d37b34c0cf06f228681:1"> The ID for your client application registered with the API provider.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a72eecfc195444fa9508f698d87e1871">**Client Secret:**<span offset-key="a72eecfc195444fa9508f698d87e1871:1"> The client secret given to you by the API provider.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="5d7c2d390968441b9f25f8a2affbe92d">**Scope:**<span offset-key="5d7c2d390968441b9f25f8a2affbe92d:1"> The scope of access you are requesting, which may include multiple space-separated values.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d8653b6560b648ec8fdb6703681e28e4">**State:**<span offset-key="d8653b6560b648ec8fdb6703681e28e4:1"> An opaque value to prevent cross-site request forgery.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ba2191203f7a46d49504e968d3aefe58">**Client Authentication:**<span offset-key="ba2191203f7a46d49504e968d3aefe58:1"> A dropdown—send a Basic Auth request in the header, or client credentials in the request body. </span>*After upgrading to a new version, change the value in this dropdown menu to avoid problems with client authentication.*</span>

<span key="d75716a80ef3489c8a101ea4829bc90c">**Advanced Options tab**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a87e088cfa7d47428914e4b95fd085ae">**Resource:**<span offset-key="a87e088cfa7d47428914e4b95fd085ae:1"> A URI that indicates the resource or target service where the token is intended to be used.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c53427a55e6342df8b71e5447a66ac89">**Audience:**<span offset-key="c53427a55e6342df8b71e5447a66ac89:1"> A URI that indicates the target audience or service where the token is intended to be used.</span></span>

<span key="7769dd1681f44b5ca1e25d0d5292ef4c"><span offset-key="7769dd1681f44b5ca1e25d0d5292ef4c:0">When your config is complete, click </span>**Get New Access Token**<span offset-key="7769dd1681f44b5ca1e25d0d5292ef4c:2">.</span></span>

> <span key="18f0de7c944b47e38bdbd66ca87f7f18"><span offset-key="18f0de7c944b47e38bdbd66ca87f7f18:0">When you use </span>**Authorization code**<span offset-key="18f0de7c944b47e38bdbd66ca87f7f18:2"> or </span>**Implicit**<span offset-key="18f0de7c944b47e38bdbd66ca87f7f18:4"> grant type, you will be prompted to supply your credentials to retrieve an access token to use in subsequent requests. By default Postman will display a pop-up browser when you click </span>**Request Token**<span offset-key="18f0de7c944b47e38bdbd66ca87f7f18:6">. You can alternatively choose to authenticate using your system's default web browser. Select </span>**Authorize using browser**<span offset-key="18f0de7c944b47e38bdbd66ca87f7f18:8"> and the </span>**Callback URL**<span offset-key="18f0de7c944b47e38bdbd66ca87f7f18:10"> will autofill to return to Postman when you have completed auth in the browser, so that your requests can use the token returned on successful authentication.</span></span>

<span key="f76d8dd930c54c2d8adba698842cdafb"><span offset-key="f76d8dd930c54c2d8adba698842cdafb:0">If you successfully receive a token from the API, you will see its details, together with the expiry, and optionally a refresh token you can use to retrieve a new access token when your current one expires. Click </span>**Use Token**<span offset-key="f76d8dd930c54c2d8adba698842cdafb:2"> to select the returned value.</span></span>

<span key="56ccc8c842f6466e84327832d198745f"><span offset-key="56ccc8c842f6466e84327832d198745f:0">Any successfully retrieved tokens will be listed in the request </span>**Available Tokens**<span offset-key="56ccc8c842f6466e84327832d198745f:2"> dropdown list. Select one to send with your request. Select </span>**Manage Tokens**<span offset-key="56ccc8c842f6466e84327832d198745f:4"> in the dropdown list to view more details or delete your tokens.</span></span>

<span key="2023b6ccad55448694600b1e7603167b"><span offset-key="2023b6ccad55448694600b1e7603167b:0">If authentication fails or times out, Postman will display an error message. You can check the error details in the console, </span>**Retry**<span offset-key="2023b6ccad55448694600b1e7603167b:2"> to attempt authentication again, or edit your auth details before continuing.</span></span>

> <span key="6d8839da5d7c402eb55126727d543a3d"><span offset-key="6d8839da5d7c402eb55126727d543a3d:0">Deleting a token in Postman does not revoke access. Only the server that issues the token can revoke it.</span></span>

## 

<span key="d50e670c13ad42d48f804920d77ae911"><span offset-key="d50e670c13ad42d48f804920d77ae911:0">Hawk authentication</span></span>

<span key="6c80d28d7c8d498bb6838a4a69876343"><span offset-key="6c80d28d7c8d498bb6838a4a69876343:0">Hawk authentication enables you to authorize requests using partial cryptographic verification.</span></span>

<span key="945c7022f357432a933df93f5af8e2b6"><span offset-key="945c7022f357432a933df93f5af8e2b6:0">In the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="945c7022f357432a933df93f5af8e2b6:2"> tab for a request, select </span>**Hawk Authentication**<span offset-key="945c7022f357432a933df93f5af8e2b6:4"> from the </span>**Type**<span offset-key="945c7022f357432a933df93f5af8e2b6:6"> dropdown list.</span></span>

<span key="b5703924a3ab4f74a479d84f2ae1fb4c"><span offset-key="b5703924a3ab4f74a479d84f2ae1fb4c:0">Hawk Auth</span></span>

<span key="785281db77324551b49a9039c6f9c03d"><span offset-key="785281db77324551b49a9039c6f9c03d:0">Enter your details in the </span>**Hawk Auth ID**<span offset-key="785281db77324551b49a9039c6f9c03d:2">, </span>**Hawk Auth Key**<span offset-key="785281db77324551b49a9039c6f9c03d:4">, and </span>**Algorithm**<span offset-key="785281db77324551b49a9039c6f9c03d:6"> fields. You can optionally set advanced details, but Postman will attempt to generate values for them if necessary.</span></span>

> <span key="5c3ea17685b9440ba645104874d38f33"><span offset-key="5c3ea17685b9440ba645104874d38f33:0">When the required details are complete in the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="5c3ea17685b9440ba645104874d38f33:2"> tab for your request, Postman will add them to the </span>**Headers**<span offset-key="5c3ea17685b9440ba645104874d38f33:4">.</span></span>

<span key="b2551229b4c74d508d7c6395b5342fce"><span offset-key="b2551229b4c74d508d7c6395b5342fce:0">The Hawk Authentication parameters are as follows:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="dd83d988be224002875e01595a21a07a">**Hawk Auth ID:**<span offset-key="dd83d988be224002875e01595a21a07a:1"> Your API authentication ID value.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="f407fc8eafad41b8a4fa6fd02720a240">**Hawk Auth Key:**<span offset-key="f407fc8eafad41b8a4fa6fd02720a240:1"> Your API authentication key value.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ab7c3900391f4e63901d2d4c017d7ca6">**Algorithm:**<span offset-key="ab7c3900391f4e63901d2d4c017d7ca6:1"> The hash algorithm used to create the message authentication code (MAC).</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="da629bf5e14c42f891277c2e5fa049d6"><span offset-key="da629bf5e14c42f891277c2e5fa049d6:0">Advanced parameters:</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="4b1af36043404143bc77f7db99f1f52d">**User:**<span offset-key="4b1af36043404143bc77f7db99f1f52d:1"> The username.</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="0e69d0f5c539453c90215a3801f6a1d0">**Nonce:**<span offset-key="0e69d0f5c539453c90215a3801f6a1d0:1"> A random string generated by the client.</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="c287f9295d364924a6d7364f44e05285">**ext:**<span offset-key="c287f9295d364924a6d7364f44e05285:1"> Any application-specific information to be sent with the request.</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="6a193dbb765543cfa1577eba1d819f8a">**app:**<span offset-key="6a193dbb765543cfa1577eba1d819f8a:1"> The binding between credentials and the application to prevent an attacker using credentials issued to someone else.</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="dbcdb4190de343aca0ecd3d905d286dc">**dlg:**<span offset-key="dbcdb4190de343aca0ecd3d905d286dc:1"> The ID of the application the credentials were issued to.</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="fc3f3b4cdbee44f1a4a423181f19250e">**Timestamp:**<span offset-key="fc3f3b4cdbee44f1a4a423181f19250e:1"> Timestamp the server uses to prevent replay attacks outside the time window.</span></span>

## 

<span key="2e29445c39ee4f2f9f6db04d1edd42c3"><span offset-key="2e29445c39ee4f2f9f6db04d1edd42c3:0">AWS Signature</span></span>

<span key="4c2406cdc3604b8aaf180f759116f493"><span offset-key="4c2406cdc3604b8aaf180f759116f493:0">AWS is the authorization workflow for Amazon Web Services requests. AWS uses a custom HTTP scheme based on a keyed-HMAC (Hash Message Authentication Code) for authentication.</span></span>

<span key="f0b6b5151880410ca264490db32d8005"><span offset-key="f0b6b5151880410ca264490db32d8005:0">The official AWS Signature documentation provides more detail:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c049b17869984ae7a5ef1706fdd8c6ff"><span offset-key="c049b17869984ae7a5ef1706fdd8c6ff:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/RESTAuthentication.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="24fff21ee3554b708e6ea344bb68d58f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="bca59f6140814b329c44315bc716503c"><span data-offset-key="bca59f6140814b329c44315bc716503c:0">Signing and Authenticating REST Requests</span></span></span></a><span key="e098e4bc4adf4b728601ca4f0a5f8550"><span offset-key="e098e4bc4adf4b728601ca4f0a5f8550:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="38d40530440b4565a0a27fd6b610f7a6"><span offset-key="38d40530440b4565a0a27fd6b610f7a6:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/apigateway/latest/developerguide/how-to-call-api.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="d9547636938a45f3a1d411e360619bfc" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="fe56321acbfc4472acaa0759d8722be0"><span data-offset-key="fe56321acbfc4472acaa0759d8722be0:0">Use Postman to Call an API</span></span></span></a><span key="b5ecb6169738445a971f5a5159b046ae"><span offset-key="b5ecb6169738445a971f5a5159b046ae:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="53ff712c457a4520894e7d5a0885a086"><span offset-key="53ff712c457a4520894e7d5a0885a086:0">In the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="53ff712c457a4520894e7d5a0885a086:2"> tab for a request, select </span>**AWS Signature**<span offset-key="53ff712c457a4520894e7d5a0885a086:4"> from the </span>**Type**<span offset-key="53ff712c457a4520894e7d5a0885a086:6"> dropdown list.</span></span>

<span key="59d066dcda6c4610bf756ef295e1f428"><span offset-key="59d066dcda6c4610bf756ef295e1f428:0">AWS Signature Auth</span></span>

<span key="70b30b3a08634f1887408c8ea1d82fb8"><span offset-key="70b30b3a08634f1887408c8ea1d82fb8:0">Select where Postman should append your AWS auth details using the </span>**Add authorization data to**<span offset-key="70b30b3a08634f1887408c8ea1d82fb8:2"> drop-down—choosing the request headers or URL.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="d3052a169b6547d3b4d7feb70cfb947b"><span offset-key="d3052a169b6547d3b4d7feb70cfb947b:0">If you select </span>**Request Headers**<span offset-key="d3052a169b6547d3b4d7feb70cfb947b:2">, Postman will add </span>`Authorization`<span offset-key="d3052a169b6547d3b4d7feb70cfb947b:4"> and </span>`X-Amz-`<span offset-key="d3052a169b6547d3b4d7feb70cfb947b:6"> prefixed fields in the </span>**Headers**<span offset-key="d3052a169b6547d3b4d7feb70cfb947b:8"> tab.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="0cc1aa43f29b446dabb26bcbee397c86"><span offset-key="0cc1aa43f29b446dabb26bcbee397c86:0">If you select </span>**Request URL**<span offset-key="0cc1aa43f29b446dabb26bcbee397c86:2">, Postman will add the auth details in </span>**Params**<span offset-key="0cc1aa43f29b446dabb26bcbee397c86:4"> with keys prefixed </span>`X-Amz-`<span offset-key="0cc1aa43f29b446dabb26bcbee397c86:6">.</span></span>

<span key="277cf8e29259497e9d6143c910f3adcf"><span offset-key="277cf8e29259497e9d6143c910f3adcf:0">Enter your access key and secret values either directly in the fields or via variables for additional security.</span></span>

<span key="8536106cc5d44df8aeccb6615bfaf55e"><span offset-key="8536106cc5d44df8aeccb6615bfaf55e:0">You can optionally set advanced fields, but Postman will attempt to auto-generate these if necessary.</span></span>

<span key="c5ec5c9c463041fc90a461fb8e7f2cec"><span offset-key="c5ec5c9c463041fc90a461fb8e7f2cec:0">The AWS Signature parameters are as follows:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="90b3214a41224250b1be49b6388b7698">**AWS Region:**<span offset-key="90b3214a41224250b1be49b6388b7698:1"> The region receiving the request (defaults to </span>`us-east-1`<span offset-key="90b3214a41224250b1be49b6388b7698:3">).</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4c448c75180545f0a8497c47e89b0963">**Service Name:**<span offset-key="4c448c75180545f0a8497c47e89b0963:1"> The service receiving the request.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2a62204ce40043b7b00e5383f3cba4cb">**Session Token:**<span offset-key="2a62204ce40043b7b00e5383f3cba4cb:1"> Required only when using temporary security credentials.</span></span>

## 

<span key="b634bfd49cab44b7aadb28076c5370da"><span offset-key="b634bfd49cab44b7aadb28076c5370da:0">NTLM authentication</span></span>

<span key="a3ecb2a5235e45f0b6f5f1fb0df42b23"><span offset-key="a3ecb2a5235e45f0b6f5f1fb0df42b23:0">Windows Challenge/Response (NTLM) is the authorization flow for the Windows operating system and for standalone systems.</span></span>

<span key="43e9ed850cf84c698d4a59adbf0daeee"><span offset-key="43e9ed850cf84c698d4a59adbf0daeee:0">In the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="43e9ed850cf84c698d4a59adbf0daeee:2"> tab for a request, select </span>**NTLM Authentication**<span offset-key="43e9ed850cf84c698d4a59adbf0daeee:4"> from the </span>**Type**<span offset-key="43e9ed850cf84c698d4a59adbf0daeee:6"> dropdown list.</span></span>

<span key="fa08afdaa318448aab7444ebcac83b71"><span offset-key="fa08afdaa318448aab7444ebcac83b71:0">NTLM Authentication</span></span>

<span key="440f2ed453df4d4dbbe7a85445890bb5"><span offset-key="440f2ed453df4d4dbbe7a85445890bb5:0">Enter your </span>**Username**<span offset-key="440f2ed453df4d4dbbe7a85445890bb5:2"> and </span>**Password**<span offset-key="440f2ed453df4d4dbbe7a85445890bb5:4"> for NTLM access (use variables to avoid entering the values directly). You can optionally specify advanced parameters, but Postman will attempt to autocomplete these if necessary. By default your request will run a second time after extracting data received from the first—you can disable this by checking the checkbox.</span></span>

<span key="199b6ffeca164693b27ed4a593a926de"><span offset-key="199b6ffeca164693b27ed4a593a926de:0">Advanced parameters for NTLM auth are as follows:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="ca09f5a1869e411a8599f8b6e43aa0da">**Domain:**<span offset-key="ca09f5a1869e411a8599f8b6e43aa0da:1"> The domain or host to authenticate against.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="da48bfb40c6b4e898d150e740ebb2264">**Workstation:**<span offset-key="da48bfb40c6b4e898d150e740ebb2264:1"> The hostname of the PC.</span></span>

## 

<span key="f509c3e0f7214f5c97b592104f41d6ec"><span offset-key="f509c3e0f7214f5c97b592104f41d6ec:0">Akamai EdgeGrid</span></span>

<span key="e9fceac591be43cab703c0378043b1b8"><span offset-key="e9fceac591be43cab703c0378043b1b8:0">Akamai Edgegrid is an authorization helper developed and used by Akamai.</span></span>

<span key="790597c0241b4d2f9d13e18af88ec98b"><span offset-key="790597c0241b4d2f9d13e18af88ec98b:0">In the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="790597c0241b4d2f9d13e18af88ec98b:2"> tab for a request, select </span>**Akamai EdgeGrid**<span offset-key="790597c0241b4d2f9d13e18af88ec98b:4"> from the </span>**Type**<span offset-key="790597c0241b4d2f9d13e18af88ec98b:6"> dropdown list.</span></span>

<span key="91a7514f0c88411bb0989fc12cc540da"><span offset-key="91a7514f0c88411bb0989fc12cc540da:0">Akamai EdgeGrid Auth</span></span>

<span key="b7f026425093425d9c88ed81ec7d6218"><span offset-key="b7f026425093425d9c88ed81ec7d6218:0">Enter your </span>**Access Token**<span offset-key="b7f026425093425d9c88ed81ec7d6218:2">, </span>**Client Token**<span offset-key="b7f026425093425d9c88ed81ec7d6218:4">, and </span>**Client Secret**<span offset-key="b7f026425093425d9c88ed81ec7d6218:6">, using variables for additional security—you will receive these details when you register a client application with Akamai.</span></span>

> <span key="0416f3213a294a29a5e2cd7a6439e868"><span offset-key="0416f3213a294a29a5e2cd7a6439e868:0">When the required details are complete in the </span>**Authorization**<span offset-key="0416f3213a294a29a5e2cd7a6439e868:2"> tab for your request, Postman will add them to the </span>**Headers**<span offset-key="0416f3213a294a29a5e2cd7a6439e868:4">.</span></span>

<span key="af3170d3a8c64a90b9bd3a5bb632f747"><span offset-key="af3170d3a8c64a90b9bd3a5bb632f747:0">For information on obtaining your credentials, see </span></span><a href="https://developer.akamai.com/legacy/introduction/Prov_Creds.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="63bb4a0e1b5a4801bb300be0086f3bb3" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="81f5f6b0ba784806a0b0db6f69f7b5d6"><span data-offset-key="81f5f6b0ba784806a0b0db6f69f7b5d6:0">Akamai Developer - Authorize your Client</span></span></span></a><span key="5720ea0c2814484886a407e011e87545"><span offset-key="5720ea0c2814484886a407e011e87545:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="b41ec1c445bb4041a680028712cf5f3c"><span offset-key="b41ec1c445bb4041a680028712cf5f3c:0">Syncing cookies</span></span>

<span key="8e349b4dc000402196e668ec834d9231"><span offset-key="8e349b4dc000402196e668ec834d9231:0">If you have session cookies in your browser, you can sync them to Postman using the Interceptor—see </span></span><a href="https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/capturing-request-data/interceptor/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3fb7dc3e1943439a88994d6020097252" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="c738121d39cf4facade644fc196a0487"><span data-offset-key="c738121d39cf4facade644fc196a0487:0">Interceptor extension</span></span></span></a><span key="328e9b4b88934577bac0e78e19c44696"><span offset-key="328e9b4b88934577bac0e78e19c44696:0"> and </span></span><a href="https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/cookies/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1dc1b81e24fa4aefaf7bd73672da356c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-42661_259-42662-237__"><span data-key="bd9c75e28c394e6ea865d93e285289e2"><span data-offset-key="bd9c75e28c394e6ea865d93e285289e2:0">Cookies</span></span></span></a><span key="0bf25ecaa126494a9c0bd22e871a3a0a"><span offset-key="0bf25ecaa126494a9c0bd22e871a3a0a:0"> for more detail.</span></span>

## 

<span key="9c231de44075418b8714a4e9e18d1d40"><span offset-key="9c231de44075418b8714a4e9e18d1d40:0">Next steps</span></span>
